item.title: 2025 in Review: Highlights from NASA in Silicon Valley - NASA
item.description: Editor's Note: This article was updated on Friday, Dec. 19, 2025, to clarify the research done by ATM-X and ACERO.

item.description: Stay up-to-date with the latest content from NASA as we explore the universe and discover more about our home planet.

item.title: NASA to Preview US Spacewalks at Space Station in January - NASA
item.description: NASA astronauts will conduct a pair of spacewalks in January outside of the International Space Station to prepare for the installation of a roll-out solar

item.title: NASA Astronaut Nick Hague Retires - NASA
item.description: NASA astronaut Brig. Gen. Nick Hague has retired from the agency, concluding a distinguished career that included two spaceflight missions, 374 days in space,

item.title: NASA Shares SpaceX Crew-12 Assignments for Space Station Mission - NASA
item.description: As part of NASA’s SpaceX Crew-12 mission, four crew members from three space agencies will launch no earlier than Sunday, Feb. 15, 2026, to the International

item.title: NASA Welcomes 15th Administrator Jared Isaacman - NASA
item.description: Jared Isaacman was sworn in Thursday as NASA's 15th administrator by District Judge Timothy J. Kelly. The oath was taken during a ceremony held at the

item.title: 2026 News Releases - NASA
item.description: Sign up to receive NASA news releases and other information.

item.title: NASA’s SPHEREx Observatory Completes First Cosmic Map Like No Other
item.description: The telescope will help scientists answer big-picture questions about everything from water deposits in the Milky Way to what happened in the first second after the big bang.

item.title: NASA’s Perseverance Mars Rover Ready to Roll for Miles in Years Ahead
item.description: The rover has been acing a long-term series of durability tests, making the most of its enhanced navigation capabilities, and ferreting out new findings about Mars’ geologic past.

item.title: NASA Study Suggests Saturn’s Moon Titan May Not Have Global Ocean
item.description: Reanalysis of data from NASA’s Cassini mission has revealed Saturn’s moon may instead have layers of slush with isolated pockets of liquid water.

item.title: NASA JPL Shakes Things Up Testing Future Commercial Lunar Spacecraft
item.description: As Firefly Aerospace prepares to follow its successful soft landing on the Moon, an engineering model for its next lander is being put through its paces.

item.title: One of NASA’s Key Cameras Orbiting Mars Takes 100,000th Image
item.description: Mesas and dunes stand out in the view snapped by HiRISE, one of the imagers aboard the agency’s Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter.

item.title: NASA, Partners Share First Data From New US-European Sea Satellite
item.description: Launched in November, Sentinel-6B will track ocean height with ultraprecision to advance marine forecasting, national security, and more.

item.title: NASA’s Webb, Curiosity Named in TIME’s Best Inventions Hall of Fame
item.description: The most powerful space telescope ever built and the car-size roving science lab on Mars are among 25 of the most iconic inventions the magazine has covered in the past quarter century.

item.title: NASA JPL Unveils Rover Operations Center for Moon, Mars Missions
item.description: The center leverages AI along with JPL’s unique infrastructure, unrivaled tools, and years of operations expertise to support industry partners developing future planetary surface missions.

item.title: NASA, SpaceX Launch US-European Satellite to Monitor Earth’s Oceans
item.description: Sentinel-6B will extend a decades-long legacy of global sea level measurements that help forecast weather, protect coastal communities, and more.

item.title: November 2025 Company Update
item.description: Throughout November, the Terran R program made key advancements across design, build, test, and launch operations. item.title: SES, Relativity Space Expand Multi-Launch Agreement for Terran R
item.description: New contract adds launch services for SES’s GEO or MEO satellites

item.title: October 2025 Company Update
item.description: As Terran R development continues to advance, we’re excited to share updates from October across design, build, test, and launch. item.title: September 2025 Company Update
item.description: The Terran R program continues to build momentum, and September delivered meaningful progress across design, manufacturing, testing, and launch.
